intro: Hedyosmos angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hedyosmos, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and trifoliate leaves with narrow, lance-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, typically displaying shades of yellow or green. Hedyosmos angustifolius is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
